conclusion: Plan to analyze the image to identify objects and shadows, reason through effects of moving light source, and provide conclusion.
The image shows four objects: a hat, a camera, a piece of paper, and a peach, each casting a distinct shadow labeled A, B, C, and D.
Identify objects and shadows: hat casts shadow A, camera casts shadow B, paper casts shadow C, peach casts shadow D.
Understand light source movement: shadows change due to altered angle of light when light source moves forward and above objects.
Size Change: Shadows become larger as light source moves closer because light rays spread over a larger area.
Location Change: Shadows move in direction of light source movement; if light moves forward, shadows move forward.
Shadow A (hat) will become larger and move forward.
Shadow B (camera) will become larger and move forward.
Shadow C (paper) will become larger and move forward.
Shadow D (peach) will become larger and move forward.
Conclusion: Shadows of all four objects will become larger and move forward as light source moves closer and above them.
